intro: Gardenia rutenbergiana subsp. australis, commonly known as the Australian gardenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Australia and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and fragrant white flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight for optimal growth. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes in suitable climates.
